item.title: How to install matplotlib on Mac OS X Lion
item.description: I was struggeling with installation of matplotlib on Mac OS X Lion. While trying to pip install matplotlib I saw a lot of bad stuff like src/ft2font.h:16:22: error: ft2build.h: No such file or directory src/ft2font.h:17:10: error: #include expects "FILENAME" or <FILENAME> ... lipo: can't open input file: /var/tmp//ccuS7mkF.out (No such file or directory) error: command 'llvm-gcc-4.2' failed with exit status 1 It seemed that that issue was caused by

item.title: Python easter eggs
item.description: I found some interesting easter eggs from python (2.7) recently. Try the following: from __future__ import braces import this import antigravity Do you know more?
